subject: Marketing
title: Google AdWords
description: A micro-lesson that makes Google AdWords usable.

hook.text: In 2000, Google launched AdWords with 350 advertisers. It made search profitable overnight.

buildup.text: The genius: ads appeared when people were already looking for something. Intent-based advertising.

discovery.text: Pay-per-click meant advertisers only paid when someone was interested enough to engage.

twist.text: AdWords turned Google from a search engine into the most profitable ad company in history.

climax.text: Google's ad revenue now exceeds the entire global newspaper industry's revenue.

punchline.text: The best ad is an answer to a question someone already asked.

quiz.question: What made Google AdWords revolutionary?
options: Ads appeared when users were actively searching for related topics
It offered free advertising to all small businesses
It only displayed ads in printed search results
